00039 // A test function.
00040 void SQLiteDatabase::test()
00041 {
00042 //  Sample usage code follows...
00043         std::string strFileName = "sqlite3.txt";        
00044         SQLiteDatabase db;      
00045         try     {
00046         Verbose::out(1, "*");
00047         Verbose::out(1, "Create/Open database: sqlite3.txt");
00048         db.open(strFileName);
00049         SQLiteRecordset rset(db);
00050 
00051         Verbose::out(1, "create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00052         db.execute("create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00053         Verbose::out(2, "create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00054         db.execute("create table Test2 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00055         
00056         Verbose::out(1, "Begin transaction...");
00057         db.beginTransaction();
00058         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < 10); iIndex++)
00059         {
00060                 std::string strSQL = "insert into Test1 values (" + ::getInt(iIndex) + ", 'Test1-" + ::getInt(iIndex) + "')";
00061                 Verbose::out(1, "\t" + strSQL);
00062                 db.execute(strSQL);
00063         }
00064         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < 10); iIndex++)
00065         {
00066                 std::string strSQL = "insert into Test2 values (" + ::getInt(iIndex) + ", 'Test2-" + ::getInt(iIndex) + "')";
00067                 Verbose::out(1, "\t" + strSQL);
00068                 db.execute(strSQL);
00069         }
00070         Verbose::out(1, "Commit transaction...");
00071         db.commitTransaction();
00072         
00073         Verbose::out(1, "select Test1.id, Test1.Name, Test2.Name from Test1, Test2 where Test1.Id = Test2.id");
00074         rset.open("select Test1.id, Test1.Name, Test2.Name from Test1, Test2 where Test1.Id = Test2.id");
00075         while (rset.fetch())
00076         {
00077                 int iID = rset.getInteger(0);
00078                 std::string strName = rset.getString(1);
00079                 std::string strName2 = rset.getString(2);
00080                 Verbose::out(1, "\tfetched: " + ::getInt(iID) + ", " + strName + ", " + strName2);
00081         }
00082         rset.close();   
00083         
00084         Verbose::out(1, "drop table Test1");
00085         db.execute("drop table Test1");
00086         Verbose::out(1, "drop table Test2");
00087         db.execute("drop table Test2");
00088         
00089         Verbose::out(1, "Closing SQLite database");
00090         db.close();
00091         Verbose::out(1, "*");
00092         } catch (SQLiteException& e) {db.rollbackTransaction(); db.close(); Verbose::out(1, e.getMessage());} 
00093 //  End sample usage code
00094 }

00115 /** 
00116  * Error handling function. Throws a SQLiteException pointer.
00117  * The error code and Message will be combined into the SQLiteException message.
00118  * @param iReturnCode - The error code from SQLite.
00119  * @param strMessage - The error message.
00120  */
00121 void SQLiteDatabase::error(int iReturnCode, const std::string& strMessage) 
00122 { 
00123         std::stringstream ss;
00124         std::string str;
00125         ss << iReturnCode;
00126         ss >> str;
00127             
00128           
00129         std::string strMsg;
00130         /* Note: the journal file is always created in the same directory as the database file.
00131          * Changing the temp directory has no affect on the journal file.
00132          */
00133         if ( (iReturnCode == SQLITE_CANTOPEN ) && !Fs::isWriteableDir(Fs::dirname( m_dbName) ) ) {
00134           strMsg = "ERROR: sqlite3 update permission denied...journal file write failed because parent directory is not writeable: " + Fs::dirname(m_dbName);
00135         }
00136         else{
00137           strMsg = "ERROR: SQLiteCode: " + str + ", Message: " + strMessage;
00138         }
00139         throw SQLiteException(strMsg);
00140 
00141 } 
00142 
00143 /** 
00144  * Opens a SQLite database.
00145  * @param strFileName - The name of the file to open.
00146  * @param bReadOnly - true if the file is to be opened read only, else false. (Defaults to false.)
00147  */
00148 void SQLiteDatabase::open(const std::string& strFileName, bool bReadOnly)
00149 {
00150         int iReturnCode = SQLITE_OK;
00151         m_dbName = strFileName;
00152         std::string tmp_unc_path=Fs::convertToUncPath(m_dbName);
00153         for(int iIndex=0; iIndex < 10; iIndex++)
00154         {    
00155             iReturnCode = sqlite3_open(tmp_unc_path.c_str(), &m_pdb);
00156             sqlite3_extended_result_codes(m_pdb, 1);
00157            
00158             if (iReturnCode == SQLITE_BUSY)
00159             {
00160                 Verbose::out(4, "SQLiteDatabase::open failed on attempt " + ::ToStr(iIndex));
00161                 #ifndef WIN32 
00162                   struct timespec tWait, tRet;
00163                   tWait.tv_sec = 1;
00164                   tWait.tv_nsec = 0;
00165                   nanosleep(&tWait, &tRet);
00166                #endif 
00167             }
00168             else
00169             {
00170                 break;
00171             }
00172         }
00173         if(iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK)
00174         {
00175                 Verbose::out(4, "SQLiteDatabase::open failed to open SQLite file  " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_path) + " with error code " + ::ToStr(iReturnCode));
00176                 error(iReturnCode, "Failed to open SQLite file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_path));
00177         }
00178         m_bOpen = true;
00179 }

00181 /** 
00182  * Closes a SQLite database.
00183  */
00184 void SQLiteDatabase::close()
00185 {
00186         if (m_bOpen)
00187         {
00188                 int iReturnCode = sqlite3_close(m_pdb);
00189                 if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {error(iReturnCode, "Failed to close SQLite file.");}
00190                 m_bOpen = false;
00191                 m_dbName.clear();
00192         }
00193 }
00194 
00195 /** 
00196  * Executes a SQL statement. Does not return any data.
00197  * @param strSQL - The SQL statement to execute.
00198  * @param bError - Set to true to trap SQL statement errors, or false to ignore.
00199  * @param abortOnErr - true calls Err::abort on SQLite exception, else just throw the exception.
00200  */
00201 void SQLiteDatabase::execute(const std::string& strSQL, bool bError, bool abortOnErr )
00202 {
00203   try  {
00204     if (m_pdb == NULL) {
00205       throw SQLiteException("ERROR: SQLite Database has not been opened.");
00206     }
00207     char* pszMsg = NULL;
00208     int iReturnCode = sqlite3_exec(m_pdb, strSQL.c_str(), NULL, NULL, &pszMsg);
00209     if (bError)  {
00210       if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {
00211         std::string str = pszMsg;
00212         sqlite3_free(pszMsg);
00213         error(iReturnCode, str);
00214       }
00215     }
00216     else {
00217       if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {
00218         sqlite3_free(pszMsg);
00219       }
00220     }
00221   }   
00222   catch(SQLiteException e)  {
00223     if ( abortOnErr ) {
00224       Err::errAbort(std::string("SQLite Database exception: ") + e.getMessage());
00225     }
00226     else {
00227       throw(e);
00228     }
00229   } 
00230 }

00236 SQLiteRecordset::SQLiteRecordset(SQLiteDatabase& db)

00241         m_bOpen = false;

00253 /** 
00254  * Prepares a SQL statement.
00255  * @param strSQL - The SQL statement.
00256  */
00257 void SQLiteRecordset::open(const std::string& strSQL)
00258 {
00259         const char* pszTail = NULL;
00260         int iReturnCode = SQLITE_OK;
00261         for(int iIndex=0; iIndex < 10; iIndex++)
00262         {
00263             iReturnCode = sqlite3_prepare_v2(&(m_pdb->getConnection()), strSQL.c_str(), (int)strSQL.length(), &m_pstmt, &pszTail); 
00264 
00265             if (iReturnCode == SQLITE_BUSY)
00266             {
00267                 Verbose::out(4, "SQLiteRecordset::open failed on attempt " + ::ToStr(iIndex) + " with sqlite3 error code " + ::ToStr(iReturnCode) );
00268                 #ifndef WIN32 
00269                   struct timespec tWait, tRet;
00270                   tWait.tv_sec = 1;
00271                   tWait.tv_nsec = 0;
00272                   nanosleep(&tWait, &tRet);
00273                #endif 
00274             }
00275             else
00276             {
00277                 break;
00278             }
00279         }
00280         if(iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK)
00281         {
00282             Verbose::out(4, "SQLiteRecordset::open failed for command \"" + strSQL + "\" with sqlite3 error code " + ::ToStr(iReturnCode) );
00283             m_pdb->error(iReturnCode, "Failed to prepare SQL statement.");  
00284         }
00285         m_bOpen = true;
00286         m_bFirstRow = true;
00287         m_bEOF = false;
00288 }

00290 /** 
00291  * Closes the SQLiterecordset.
00292  */
00293 void SQLiteRecordset::close()
00294 {
00295         if (m_bOpen)
00296         {
00297                 //int iReturnCode = 
00298     sqlite3_finalize(m_pstmt);
00299 //              if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {m_pdb->error(iReturnCode, "Failed to finalize SQL statement.");}
00300         }
00301         m_bOpen = false;
00302         m_bFirstRow = false;
00303 }

00305 /** 
00306  * Steps through the result set from a prepared SQL statement.
00307  * @return - bool true if more rows to fetch, or false if the end of the recordset has been reached.
00308  */
00309 bool SQLiteRecordset::fetch() 
00310 {
00311         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_step(m_pstmt);  
00312         if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_ROW) {m_bEOF = true;} 
00313         return !m_bEOF;
00314 }

00316 /** 
00317  * Get a String value from the recordset.
00318  * @param iColumnIndex - The zero based index of the column.
00319  * @return - String value retrieved from column.
00320  */
00321 std::string SQLiteRecordset::getString(int iColumnIndex) 
00322 {       
00323         AffxString str;
00324         char* p = (char*)sqlite3_column_text(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00325         if (p != NULL) {str = p;}
00326         return str;
00327 }
00328 
00329 /** 
00330  * Get an integer value from the recordset.
00331  * @param iColumnIndex - The zero based index of the column.
00332  * @return - integer value retrieved from column.
00333  */
00334 int SQLiteRecordset::getInteger(int iColumnIndex) 
00335 {
00336         return sqlite3_column_int(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00337 } 
00338 
00339 /** 
00340  * Get a Double value from the recordset.
00341  * @param iColumnIndex - The zero based index of the column.
00342  * @return - Double value retrieved from column.
00343  */
00344 double SQLiteRecordset::getDouble(int iColumnIndex) 
00345 {
00346         if (sqlite3_column_type(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex) == SQLITE_NULL) {return std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();}
00347         return sqlite3_column_double(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00348 }
